title: Lisa Appleton treats herself to a purifying face mask

text:
She never ceases to amaze her fans with her fashion forward looks which have included butterfly nipple tassels and bin liner smocks.
But now, Lisa Appleton has given her loyal followers a glimpse of her daily beauty routine as she stepped out clad in a pore-reducing face mask on Thursday night in Cheshire.
The 48-year-old reality star caked on her purifying mud mask around her dazzling eyes and down her neck to get her skin tighter and brighter for the weekend ahead.

Aside from giving an insight into her nightly beauty routine, she showcased her incredibly toned arms as she displayed her impressive biceps in a daring black sports bra.
The flesh-flaunting star's tummy teasing number hinted at her ample cleavage and her red bra which attempted to break free from the clutches of her tiny crop top.
The former Big Brother star - who competed in a number of bodybuilding contests - owned her womanly figure as she teamed her stomach baring crop top with a pair of low-slung Adidas sports shorts that highlighted her honed pins.

Braving the plummeting temperatures, the only thing to aid her skin-flaunting look was a pair of wool lined UGGs which highlighted her alabaster skin while walking her adorable dog.
Meanwhile, the reality starlet is known for her over-the-top antics, which are thought to be the main reason behind her split from partner Paul in December.
However, Lisa recently admitted her audaciousness is the result of 'coming out of severe depression.'
Doggy day care: Braving the plummeting temperatures, the only thing to aid her skin-flaunting look was a pair of wool lined UGGs which highlighted her alabaster skin while walking her adorable dog
She told The Sun: 'My behaviour has been over the top and I’ve also had a blow out – I’ve ate and drunk too much. I feel like I have been let out of a cage.
'I am just starting to live again. I know I have upset a lot of people by rolling around on the beach.
'Loads of people are saying I am having a mid life crises, or it’s embarrassing, Paul has said it is embarrassing, my daughter said it was embarrassing.'
